meanings.definition: The act of changing the arrangement or structure of something.
meanings.sent1: The reconfiguration of the furniture in the living room made it feel more spacious.
meanings.sent2: The company's reconfiguration of its departments led to improved efficiency.
meanings.sent3: After the reconfiguration of the puzzle pieces, it became even more challenging to solve.
meanings.sent4: The reconfiguration of the city skyline with new skyscrapers was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The reconfiguration of the garden layout brought a sense of harmony to the space.

meanings.definition: The process of reorganizing or rearranging something.
meanings.sent1: The reconfiguration of the bookshelves made it easier to find specific titles.
meanings.sent2: The reconfiguration of the schedule allowed for more time to be spent on important tasks.
meanings.sent3: The reconfiguration of the board game pieces added a fun twist to the gameplay.
meanings.sent4: The reconfiguration of the traffic flow reduced congestion in the area.
meanings.sent5: The reconfiguration of the classroom seating arrangement improved student interaction.
